content.title: 死のエンジンレビュー - ピータージャクソンのsteampunkスターウォーズの屋台 - ガーディアン
content.desc: Mortal Engines was originally a YA dystopian adventure novel from British author Philip Reeve, published in 2001, the first of the “Mortal Engines quartet”. Among its many fans is Peter Jackson, who has now turned it into a tiringly frenetic and derivative fantasy-adventure movie, co-producing and co-writing the adaptation with Fran Walsh and Philippa Boyens. Making his directing debut here is Jackson’s former storyboard artist and visual effects supervisor Christian Rivers. The film is basically a steampunk Star Wars, with a bit of low-octane Gilliam and Gaiman on the side. By the end, in ...

content.title: 死のエンジンのレビュー：ゴールデンコンパスよりも優れていますが、ディテールが詰まっています - 独立系
content.desc: Dir; Christian Rivers; Starring: Hugo Weaving, Hera Hilmar, Robert Sheehan, Jihae, Stephen Lang. Cert 12A, 128 mins Mortal Engines, an adaptation of the first of a quartet of fantasy books by Philip Reeve, has been heavily framed in its publicity as the latest brainchild of filmmaking wizard Peter Jackson. It’s a small twist of the truth: it’s actually the directorial debut of his protégé Christian Rivers, who has worked closely with Jackson since 1992’s Braindead. Rivers, however, has learnt much from his master and, arguably, Mortal Engines could be described as coming from the “school of...

content.title: 死のエンジンのレビュー：どこにも機械的で、魂のないディストピアのテーマパークがあります -  The Telegraph
content.desc: Dir: Christian Rivers. Cast: Hera Hilmar, Robert Sheehan, Hugo Weaving, JiHAE, Stephen Lang, Patrick Malahide, Leila George, Frankie Adams. 12A cert, 128 mins Mortal Engines, a Young Adult steampunk epic from the Lord of the Rings stable, puts London on wheels, advancing voraciously across Europe in a curious inverse-of-Brexit nightmare after global apocalypse has struck. This motorised metropolis, with St Paul’s poking out the top of it and various landmarks jammed into its flanks, rolls clanking and heaving across the continent with a giant maw agape in its front, designed to hoover up ot...

content.title: 英国の映画発売日：英国の映画館にはどんな新しい映画が登場していますか？ - 独立系
content.desc: The year may be drawing to a close but there's no shortage of exciting new titles coming to UK cinemas. January and February always see a deluge of new prestige pictures released in time for awards season as we build up towards the Oscars. Here’s an overview of all the new releases hitting British screens over the coming months. Out now Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald A sequel to Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016), JK Rowling’s prequel series to Harry Potter, this new instalment is again directed by franchise regular David Yates and once more stars Eddie Redmayne as ...
